title: Ticket #1077: DAGMan should create jobstate.log
description:
(See condor-gnats 961.)

Re discussion with Ewa and Karan on 2008-12-11: they would like DAGMan itself to create the jobstate.log file that is now created by the tailstatd.
remarks:
2010-Jan-22 16:40:52 by wenger:
Timestamps in this file should definitely include the year.

2010-Jun-30 15:47:33 by psilord:
Can you put a snippet of what the output of the log should look like into the ticket?

2010-Sep-22 16:51:51 by wenger: 

  As per IM with Gaurang today:
  * _All_ events should get logged to the jobstate.log file.
  * Also generate events for PRE scripts starting and finishing.
  * Add INTERNAL *** RECOVERY_STARTED *** and INTERNAL *** RECOVERY_ENDED *** "events".

2010-Sep-22 16:55:35 by wenger:
Also be sure to test in recovery mode...

2010-Oct-11 16:02:48 by wenger: 

  More changes as per today's phone conference with Fabio, Gaurang, and Karan:
  1) In recovery mode, log the timestamp at which the event actually happened, not the current time.
  2) In recovery mode, don't re-log events we've already logged (probably have to re-read the jobstate.log file to do this).
  3) Log SUBMIT_FAILED events for condor_submit failures (don't increment sequence number).
  4) Add the Condor ID to POST_SCRIPT_STARTED, POST_SCRIPT_SUCCESS, and POST_SCRIPT_FAILURE events.

2010-Dec-03 15:07:55 by wenger:
Just merged the jobstate_log2 branch to the master, and pushed it, so the code for this should be done. Documentation is in progress, so I'm leaving the ticket active.

2011-Jan-06 10:46:21 by wenger:
I finished up the documentation on this a while ago, so I'm going to resolve the ticket.
